sourceMeaningMnemonic: The <radical>king</radical> of the <radical>flowers</radical> in the <radical>center</radical> (of England, if you remember) has a special <kanji>crystal</kanji>. The king crystal.
meaningInfo: Picture the king holding this crystal aloft, giggling as the sun shines through it and sparkles.
readingMnemonic: The king thinks everyone wants his <kanji>crystal</kanji> so he hides it in the giant <reading>a</reading>corn (<ja>えい</ja>) in the center of the flowers in England. There's a tiny hole in the bottom of the acorn, and that's where this crystal stays hidden.
readingInfo: Imagine going to England, to the giant acorn in the center of the flowers, and searching for the king's crystal. If you find it, you can probably sell it for a fortune! Or just make a really sweet necklace.
